event_text: m_c is scolded after sneaking out of camp.
m_c falls into a river but is saved by r_c.
m_c was playing with acc_plural earlier and decides to wear some of them.
No matter how hard r_c tries, there's always something stuck in m_c's fur.
m_c is too cute and r_c gives {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a pretty acc_singular as a gift.
r_c gives m_c a pretty acc_singular {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} found while playing.
m_c starts bringing a pretty acc_singular everywhere {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/go/goes} and r_c loudly complains that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/want/wants} one too.
m_c finds some acc_singular to wear in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} fur to impress r_c!
m_c and r_c sneak out of camp to chase butterflies.
m_c and r_c play with the leaves around the camp.
m_c and r_c chase fireflies around the camp while the older warriors try to sleep.
m_c and r_c make little snow lumps at the entrance to the camp.
m_c and r_c flick snow at the older warriors, giggling as they hide behind the nursery.
m_c and r_c try to sneak out of the camp, but are caught and returned to the nursery.
m_c picks some flowers around the camp to bring back to the medicine den.
m_c chases fireflies around the camp while the older warriors sleep.
m_c and r_c lead a small leaf gathering hunt while the adult cats watch with amused purrs.
m_c received a present, gently weaved acc_plural, from r_c and decided to keep it with {PRONOUN/m_c/object} on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} tail.
m_c, inbetween playfighting with r_c, collects scraps of daisies that sometimes get stuck in r_c's pelt. After quite a while, m_c {VERB/m_c/crafts/craft} a daisy corsage for {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} tail!
r_c finds a acc_singular in camp! r_c gives it to m_c, who decides to wear it!.
m_c finds a acc_singular in camp! m_c decides to wear it.

r_c ducks {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} head under the nursery's entrance, and offers m_c a flower to play with! m_c snatches it and tucks it next to {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} ear. m_c smugly flaunts it to anyone who asks about it.

m_c begs r_c to get {PRONOUN/m_c/object} something from outside of the camp, yapping about wanting to go on patrol like r_c does! r_c caves, rolling {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} eyes, and brings m_c a pretty flower {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} managed to find.

m_c manages to find a spare allium near the medicine den! {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/purr/purrs} as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/tuck/tucks} it under {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} ears -- {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} look so fashionable!

r_c finds a pretty, smelly field of onions with pretty pink blooms. Figuring that m_c would probably play with the stinky thing, r_c takes it home! m_c wears it instead, and promptly brags about {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new accessory to anyone who'll listen.
m_c finds a cool stick! {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} decide to keep it with them around camp.

r_c squints at m_c, not entirely sure if {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/believe/believes} {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} eyes as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/watch/watches} m_c drag around a raggedy tree branch around the nursery den for the fifth time. r_c asks about it, and m_c replies that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} just... really, really {VERB/m_c/like/likes} sticks, especially this one. r_c is left more confused than before.

m_c sneakily crawls out of camp on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} stubbly little legs. Luckily, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/make/makes} it back to camp a little while later in one piece, undetected by any patrols, and with a pretty flower! m_c also gets a massive scolding.

r_c finds a patch of odd red orchids. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} decide to take a pair of it's prettiest blooms to use for a gift to give to m_c! m_c prompty brags to anyone nearby about {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new accessory, with r_c rolling {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} eyes at {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} antics.

m_c whines to r_c about a pretty insect {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} found fluttering near the nursery. r_c puts {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} tail on m_c's shoulder, and leaps to go catch it for m_c! m_c purrs, and decides to wear one of the acc_plural.
m_c leaps up on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} little legs with a big, impressive leap, and catches an insect! {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/wear/wears} the acc_plural with pride.

r_c carries in an acc_singular into the nursery, asking m_c if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/want/wants} to play with it. m_c eye's sparkle with joy as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} plead for the acc_singular! r_c drops it, expecting m_c to play with it, but instead, r_c watches m_c befriend the weird little thing.
m_c peers at a little acc_singular. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/remember/remembers} r_c calling it a pest... but it's far too cute to m_c to resist befriending.

r_c spots acc_singular near camp. Before r_c can rip {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} way through camp and to the acc_singular, m_c stops {PRONOUN/r_c/object} and tells {PRONOUN/r_c/object} that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/want/wants} it as a pet. r_c opens {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mouth to hiss at m_c, but the kit bounds over to the acc_singular. Guess it's too late to catch it...
m_c disappears for a short little while, effectively sending the clan into a blind panic! m_c reappears quickly though, and with a new friend!

m_c tilts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head at the camp wall. Nobody's entirely sure why until r_c asks, amused. m_c tells r_c that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/wants/want} to wear the pretty ivy leaves growing on the camp's walls. r_c chuckles, and cuts a pair of leaves off for m_c to wear.

With an impressive leap, m_c manages to leap up with {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} stubby back legs and grab a pair of ivy leaves off of the clan camp's walls! m_c wears {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new accomplishment with pride.

m_c yaps and yowls about wanting to hunt and catch birds with r_c! Poor r_c, after a full day of m_c's yapping, gifts m_c a leftover bird skull to hold {PRONOUN/m_c/object} off until {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} apprenticeship.

m_c, in an act of pure morbid curiousity, pokes around in the fresh kill pile. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/manages/manage} to scavenge a whole bird skull! Gross! r_c helps {PRONOUN/m_c/object} wash it and properly clean it before m_c wears it around camp.

m_c naps on the side of r_c's belly. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/huff/huffs} quietly at the little snoring kitten, and {VERB/r_c/begin/begins} to gently clean {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} fur... only to find acc_singular!? What in the world has m_c been getting into?
